titleStmt.title: Letter from Lord Montrose to George Colman, 20 October 1825.

sponsor.orgName: Mary Russell Mitford Society: Digital Mitford Project

editionStmt.edition: First digital edition in TEI, date: 2 August 2013. P5.

publicationStmt.authority: Digital Mitford: The Mary Russell Mitford Archive

availability.licence: Distributed under a Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 3.0 Unported License

notesStmt.note: Any special notes on this text? (optional)
You can have multiple notes here.

msDesc.head: Letter from Lord Montrose to George Colman 20 October, 1825.

support.p: PaperOne quarto-sized sheet sheet folded once vertically and twice horizontally. No address leaf or envelope.

supportDesc.condition: Letter complete on the front and back of the first vertical fold of the sheet only. (Second leaf is blank.)

sealDesc.p: Missing address leaf or envelope and seal.

editorialDecl.p: The letter writer's spelling and punctuation are retained, except where a word is split at the end of a line and the beginning of the next in the manuscript. Where the spelling and hyphenation of words deviates from the standard, in order to facilitate searching we are using the TEI elements “choice,” “sic,” and “reg” to encode both Mitford’s spelling and the regular international standard of Oxford English spelling, following the first listed spelling in the Oxford English Dictionary. The long s and ligatured forms are not encoded.

div.p:
I return the Licenses signed. King Charles is certainly not proper for representation in my opinion, & if the Legislature will place the responsibility in such men as myself, I disdain to avoid the responsibility--
Your letters to the Manager are very proper & I remain Sir
